name: shouldDeployRedHatSsoWithDefaultValues()
description: Should deploy Red Hat SSO with all the default values in a Red Hat compliant environment
descriptionHtml: Should deploy Red Hat SSO with all the default values in a Red Hat compliant environment

testStage.description: Should deploy Red Hat SSO with all the default values in a Red Hat compliant environment

steps.name: Given that the Entando Operator is running in 'Red Hat' compliance mode
And the Operator runs in a Kubernetes environment the requires a filesystem user/group override for mounted volumes
And the routing suffix has been configured globally
And a TLS Secret was created and configured as default
And there is a controller to process requests for the DBMS capability
When I request an SSO Capability with no additional parameters
and the official Red Hat SSO Image
and it is owned by the ProvidedCapability to ensure only changes from the ProvidedCapability will change the implementing Kubernetes resources
And a PostgreSQL DBMS Capability was provided:
And a database schema was prepared for the RedHat SSO service
using a cluster local connection to the database Service
and the admin credentials provided in the PostgreSQL Capability's admin secret
and the credentials for the  schema user provided in a newly generated secret for the Red Hat SSO deployment: 'default-sso-in-namespace-db-secret'
And a Kubernetes Deployment was created reflecting the requirements of the Red Hat SSO container:
using the Red Hat SSO Image
With a volume mounted to the standard directory /opt/eap/standalone/data
Which is bound to a PersistentVolumeClain
And the File System User/Group override 185has been applied to the mount
And has admin credentials resolved from a dynamically provisioned admin secret
and the credentials for the  schema user provided in a newly generated secret for the Red Hat SSO deployment: 'default-sso-in-namespace-db-secret'
and the connection details for the database service are provided following the standard EAP Container conventions
And the admin secret specifies the standard admin user 'entando_keycloak_admin' as user and has a dynamically generated password
And a Kubernetes Service was created:
And with a label selector matching the labels of the Pod Template on the  Deployment
And a Kubernetes Ingress was created:
With a hostname derived from the Capability name, namespace and the routing suffix
And with TLS configured to use the default TLS secret
And the default TLS secret was cloned into the Capability's deployment namespace
And the resulting SsoConnectionInfo reflects the correct information to connect to the deployed SSO service
Resulting state changes in the Kubernetes cluster

labels.name: feature
labels.value: As a controller developer, I would like request an SSO Capability to be deployed on demand so that I don't need to concern myself with the details o deploying an SSO service
